gw.cc.financials.entity

Interface Transaction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Payment, Recovery, RecoveryReserve, Reserve

    public interface Transaction
    Transaction (either reserve, payment, recovery, or recovery reserve) for a particular claim or exposure.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acknowledgeSubmission()
      Acknowledges a message that this transaction was submitted.
      TransactionLineItem addNewLineItem(CurrencyAmount transAmount, java.lang.String comments, LineCategory lineCategory)
      Adds a line item to this transaction with the given transaction amount, comments, and line category.
      void addToLineItems(TransactionLineItem value)
      Adds the given element to the LineItems array.
      void findAndSetReserveLine()
      Determines the proper ReserveLine for this Transaction and sets it into the Transaction.
      java.math.BigDecimal getAmount()
      Equivalent to TransactionAmount.
      CurrencyAmount getClaimAmount()
      Returns the Claim amount of this transaction, which is the equivalent of transaction amount in the claim currency.
      java.lang.String getDetailPageTitle()
      Returns the title to use for the detail page that displays detail of is transaction - different transaction types use different titles, such as "Payment Details", "Recovery Details" and so on.
      boolean getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate()
      False if the TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount ExchangeRate is a Market Rate (Automatic) or true if it's a user-entered custom rate for this Transaction (Manual).
      boolean getOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate()
      False if the TransactionAmount to ReservingAmount ExchangeRate is a Market Rate (Automatic) or true if it's a user-entered custom rate for this Transaction (Manual).

      Returns the reporting amount of this transaction, which is the equivalent of transaction amount in the reporting currency.

      Returns the Reserving amount of this transaction, which is the amount of this transaction in the Reserving Currency.

      Gets the rounding mode that should be used when converting amounts between transaction, reserving, claim, and reporting currency for this transaction.

      Returns the transaction amount of this transaction.
      TransactionLineItem getTransactionAmountDirectlyLineItem()
      Ensures there is one and only one line item, ala setAmountDirectly, and then returns that TransactionLineItem.
      IPairedMoney getTransactionAmountReservingAmountPair()
      Returns the TransactionAmount and ReservingAmount of this transaction as an IPairedMoney.

      Returns the date of this transaction.
      java.lang.String getTransactionTypeName()
      Returns the type of the transaction subtype: Payment, Reserve, Recovery, RecoveryReserve.
      java.math.BigDecimal getTransToClaimExchangeRateRate()
      Get the TransToClaimExchangeRate entity and check that it matches the current Currency, or lookup the current Market Exchange Rate entity.
      java.math.BigDecimal getTransToReservingExchangeRateRate()
      Get the TransToReservingExchangeRate entity and check that it matches the current Currency, or lookup the current Market Exchange Rate entity.
      boolean isDeletable()
      Returns true if this Transaction can be deleted.

      Returns whether or not a Transaction can be directly edited versus needing to offset the transaction or void/recreate the transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        java.math.BigDecimal getAmount()
        Equivalent to TransactionAmount. Provided for backwards compatibility on SINGLE currency mode servers.

      • getTransactionAmount

        CurrencyAmount getTransactionAmount()
        Returns the transaction amount of this transaction. The currency of the transaction amount may differ from the Claim currency. The amount is determined by summing the transaction amounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

      • getTransactionAmountReservingAmountPair

        IPairedMoney getTransactionAmountReservingAmountPair()
        Returns the TransactionAmount and ReservingAmount of this transaction as an IPairedMoney.

      • getReservingAmount

        CurrencyAmount getReservingAmount()
        Returns the Reserving amount of this transaction, which is the amount of this transaction in the Reserving Currency. The amount is determined by summing the ReservingAmounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

      • getClaimAmount

        CurrencyAmount getClaimAmount()
        Returns the Claim amount of this transaction, which is the equivalent of transaction amount in the claim currency. The amount is determined by summing the claim amounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

      • getReportingAmount

        CurrencyAmount getReportingAmount()
        Returns the reporting amount of this transaction, which is the equivalent of transaction amount in the reporting currency. The amount is determined by summing the reporting amounts of all TransactionLineItems that belong to the transaction. Returns zero if the transaction has no line items.

      • getTransactionDate

        java.util.Date getTransactionDate()
        Returns the date of this transaction. For any Transaction subtype other than Payment, this is simply the CreateTime. For Payments, it is the IssueDate of the Payment's associated Check, if not null, otherwise it it the ScheduledSendDate of the check.
        Returns:
        Date of the check (CreateTime for non-payments, else IssueDate or ScheduledSendDate).

      • getTransactionTypeName

        java.lang.String getTransactionTypeName()
        Returns the type of the transaction subtype: Payment, Reserve, Recovery, RecoveryReserve. Value is localized.
        Returns:
        String containing the name of the transaction subtype

      • isDeletable

        boolean isDeletable()
        Returns true if this Transaction can be deleted. For Payments, Check.Deleteable should normally be used instead, since, after a Check has been created, its Payments cannot be deleted individually--the entire Check must be deleted.

      • isEditable

        boolean isEditable()
        Returns whether or not a Transaction can be directly edited versus needing to offset the transaction or void/recreate the transaction. For all Transaction subtypes, returns true if the status is null. For Reserves and RecoveryReserves, returns true if the transaction is unapproved or rejected and its exposure is not closed. For Payments and Recoveries, returns true if the transaction has not been submitted.

      • isNotApproved

        boolean isNotApproved()
        Returns true if the LifeCycleState indicates the transaction is unapproved or rejected. Specifically, if the LifeCycleState is one of the following:
        • TransactionLifeCycleState.DRAFT
        • TransactionLifeCycleState.PENDINGAPPROVAL
        • TransactionLifeCycleState.REJECTED

      • addNewLineItem

        TransactionLineItem addNewLineItem(CurrencyAmount transAmount,
                                   java.lang.String comments,
                                   LineCategory lineCategory)
        Adds a line item to this transaction with the given transaction amount, comments, and line category. This transaction must be editable for a lineitem to be added. NOTE: When called through rules, this method should only be called from the TransactionSet pre-setup ruleset.
        Returns:
        the line item created

      • removeFromLineItemsIfEditable

        void removeFromLineItemsIfEditable(TransactionLineItem lineItem)
        Removes the given transaction line item from this transaction.
        Parameters:
        lineItem - line item to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the transaction is not editable

      • getTransactionAmountDirectlyLineItem

        TransactionLineItem getTransactionAmountDirectlyLineItem()
        Ensures there is one and only one line item, ala setAmountDirectly, and then returns that TransactionLineItem. Only works for editable transactions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if transaction is not editable

      • setReserveLine

        void setReserveLine(ReserveLine value)
        Sets the Transaction's ReserveLine. This is only possible if the Transaction is editable. This method has the following critical side effects for existing Transactions:

        1. Transitions the Transaction to the 'Retired' LifeCycleState on its current ReserveLine so that its contributions to the TAccounts for that reserveline are offset
        2. Transitions the Transaction back to its original LifeCycleState on the new ReserveLine.

      • getDetailPageTitle

        java.lang.String getDetailPageTitle()
        Returns the title to use for the detail page that displays detail of is transaction - different transaction types use different titles, such as "Payment Details", "Recovery Details" and so on.

      • findAndSetReserveLine

        void findAndSetReserveLine()
        Determines the proper ReserveLine for this Transaction and sets it into the Transaction. If an existing ReserveLine is a match, then this ReserveLine is used. Otherwise, a new ReserveLine is created and used. If this Transaction already has a non-null Reserveline and it is not in 'New' or 'Draft' LifeCycleState, then this method has no effect (i.e., you cannot change the ReserveLine of a Transaction once it has been permanently saved to the database).

        Note: This method should only be called on a new Reserve.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this Reserve is not new

      • getTransToClaimExchangeRateRate

        java.math.BigDecimal getTransToClaimExchangeRateRate()
        Get the TransToClaimExchangeRate entity and check that it matches the current Currency, or lookup the current Market Exchange Rate entity. Return the ER entity's Rate. Or return ONE if it's null and/or in SINGLE currency mode.

      • getTransToReservingExchangeRateRate

        java.math.BigDecimal getTransToReservingExchangeRateRate()
        Get the TransToReservingExchangeRate entity and check that it matches the current Currency, or lookup the current Market Exchange Rate entity. Return the ER entity's Rate. Or return ONE if it's null and/or in SINGLE currency mode.

      • setTransToClaimExchangeRateRate

        void setTransToClaimExchangeRateRate(java.math.BigDecimal exchangeRate)
        Set the Rate on the TransToClaimExchangeRate entity. IGNORED if the ExchangeRate entity is part of a Market Rates set (should call setOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate(true) first), OR if the exchangeRate is null OR server is in SINGLE currency mode.

      • getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate

        boolean getOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate()
        False if the TransactionAmount to ClaimAmount ExchangeRate is a Market Rate (Automatic) or true if it's a user-entered custom rate for this Transaction (Manual).

      • getOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate

        boolean getOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate()
        False if the TransactionAmount to ReservingAmount ExchangeRate is a Market Rate (Automatic) or true if it's a user-entered custom rate for this Transaction (Manual).

      • setOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate

        void setOverrideTransToClaimExchangeRate(boolean customOverride)

      • setOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate

        void setOverrideTransToReservingExchangeRate(boolean customOverride)
        Sets the TransToReservingExchangeRate to be a custom rate rather than a market rate
        Parameters:
        customOverride -

      • getRoundingMode

        java.math.RoundingMode getRoundingMode()
        Gets the rounding mode that should be used when converting amounts between transaction, reserving, claim, and reporting currency for this transaction. See also CCCurrencyUtil.getRoundingMode().
        Returns:
        the rounding mode to be used when converting the amounts for this transaction

      • acknowledgeSubmission

        void acknowledgeSubmission()
        Acknowledges a message that this transaction was submitted. Updates its status to SUBMITTED.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this transaction is not in SUBMITTING status

      • setTransToReservingExchangeRateRate

        void setTransToReservingExchangeRateRate(java.math.BigDecimal bigDecimal)
        Sets the Rate of the TransToReserveExchangeRate field.
        Parameters:
        bigDecimal - rate to use

      • setClaim

        void setClaim(Claim value)
        Sets the value of the Claim field.

      • setCurrency

        void setCurrency(Currency value)
        Sets the value of the Currency field.

      • setReservingCurrency

        void setReservingCurrency(Currency value)
        Sets the value of the ReservingCurrency field.

      • setTransToReservingExchangeRate

        void setTransToReservingExchangeRate(ExchangeRate value)
        Sets the value of the TransToReservingExchangeRate field.

      • setTransToClaimExchangeRate

        void setTransToClaimExchangeRate(ExchangeRate value)
        Sets the value of the TransToClaimExchangeRate field.

      • setClaimToReportingExchangeRate

        void setClaimToReportingExchangeRate(ExchangeRate value)
        Sets the value of the ClaimToReportingExchangeRate field.

      • addToLineItems

        void addToLineItems(TransactionLineItem value)
        Adds the given element to the LineItems array. This is achieved by setting the parent foreign key to this entity instance.
